Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Flaring bowl with a rounded base, a concave S-profile and a simple, tapered lip. The clay is relatively coarse and heterogeneous. The surface was polished and then burnished with very little care on the inner rim and the entire exterior surface. The interior surface is black, as is the irregular black outer rim, whereas the exterior surface is brick-red. This vessel was placed near the head of the deceased, in a pottery deposit that also contained, as usual, a storage jar, jars for food products, bowl, a cooking pot and so on.
